draw.mission_task_and_description: Apache Troop / Student Age Center (SAC) Community Outreach Event - 07AUG24

subtasks.hazard: Tactical Vehicle maneuvering IVO of Dismounts

values: Soldiers will adhere to all speed limits when operating around Rose Barracks.
Maximum of 5mph if operating within 8 meters of dismounted troops or with a ground guide.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
All Soldiers inside of a tactical vehicle will either be seated in a designated seating platform with a seatbelt, or standing with a restraint harness.
Soldiers will be no higher than name-tape defilade if standing/outside of vehicle while it is moving.
Leaders understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
Tactical Vehicles will use a ground guide when maneuvering within 10 meters of dismounts.
PCC/PCI, Safety & Ramp Briefs, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, Safeties, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, Lightning, slippery roads, etc)

values: Vehicles adhere to all speed limits when operating around Rose Barracks
Vehicles will reduce speeds IOT allow safe operation.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
If there is lightning in the area, training will halt, SMs will move to covered areas or areas away from high conductors.
SMs will ground equipment in a formation until it is safe to continue training
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, falls & other misc. injuries

values: Soldiers climbing on top of tactical vehicles wear a helmet and maintain 3-points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
No soldier will be out of the front hatch of a ICV-D while the vehicle is moving on unimproved roads
OIC/RSO understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
A designated vehicle will be marked properly for CASEVAC/MEDEVAC.
Driver and Medic/CLS certified person will be briefed on routes, and strip maps with coordinates of AXP stored in vehicle.
Medic will carry medic certification paperwork at all times.
Driver and Medic will remain with MEDEVAC Vehicle at all times.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Rehearsals
OIC/NCOIC, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and during training period IAW WE SOP.
Sensitive items will be accounted for after every mission/iteration.
All issued sensitive items tied down IAW Troop SOP.
Sensitive items inventory conducted IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.
Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, SOPs, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Soldiers

Soldiers will be briefed on weather conditions and carry appropriate items from their ECWS. -Refresher class on signs of hot and cold weather injuries. -OIC sets the uniform and NCOs enforce those standards to reduce threat of heat/cold weather related injuries.
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Prior to event, clear any weapon system mounted on Strykers
Prior to event, conduct deliberate ammunition shakedown in/around vehicles and soldiers
Remove firing pin of weapon systems
Ensure weapons are always pointed in safe direction
Weapons Clearing, SOPS, Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Prevent children from approaching/being within arms reach of any part of Stryker that could shift the gear of the vehicle
All of the keys to the vehicles will stay out of ignition and in centralized location or with driver
Chock blocks present under wheels of parked vehicles
Vehicle in park / Breaks engaged
Safety Brief, SOPS, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Ensure all hatches are opened and secured prior to start of event
Secure all hatches with 550 cord so they can't move/close shut
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions, Leaders Spot Checking
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Rear troop door closes on individual

values: Rear troop door is opened completely, on flat surface, prior to start of event
Vehicle engine remains off throughout duration of event
Training audience brief on dangers of door, unsafe locations around door, and raising switches to avoid
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions, Leaders Spot Checking
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Injuries from cuts by sharp edges in/around Stryker vehicles

values: Vehicle crews identify and mark overly sharp and protruding areas inside of the vehicles with Red Duct Tape.
Children under constant supervision when inside of vehicles. Soldiers monitor to ensure children are avoiding any unsafe surfaces.
Visual Markings, Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, or falls when on/around rear ramp of vehicle.

values: Ensure soldiers assist children as they enter the vehicles.
Soldiers ensure children are not jumping off or on to the rear ramp.
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Ensure Equipment that broadcasts or uses classified data is not displayed to training audience
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Ensure the Fire Extinguishers inside of the Strykers are present and serviceable
Ensure the serviceability of the AFES systems in each vehicle
PMCS of Vehicles, Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Spot Checking by Leaders
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Soldiers brief children on dangers of leaving immediate training area
Soldier identify to the children the limits of where they may be. Use traffic cones and white engineer tape and instruct children to not pass this area
Soldiers be attentive to PAX count upon arrival to station and at exit (line up single file and count)
SAC workers preferably could move with the groups of kids and walk with them to the follow on stations
Lane marking, Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Instructional period being deemed harsh or offensive by parent or guardian of children

values: Initiative by SAC or 1/A to create a signed waiver for each legal guardian to sign off stating they approve of the demonstration
Have alternative instructional plan for those students that can not participate in the Stryker round robin.
Creation of waiver, Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Children touching any potentially overly dangerous medical material while in/around the MEV

values: Ensure that any areas in/around the MEV that would have children present have the following items removed: needles, drugs/controlled substances, automatic defibrillators
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions, Spot checking by leadership
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Exposure to heavy rain, lightning, hail, or extreme winds/tornado

values: Immediately move the children in a quick and orderly fashion to a safe, secure area with strong overhead cover (not conductor).
Take cover underneath sturdy tables or desks
Cancel main outdoor training plan and continue, when safe, with alternate training plan
Monitoring current and future weather updates, Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Minimize the time children spend in direct sunlight. Find and utilize areas of shade.
Keep vehicle hatches opened (secured and fastened)
Ensure there is a Medic on Standby at MEV site with CLS Bag
Soldiers be attentive to warning signed of heat injuries (heat exhaustion, heat stroke)
Have a cooler with iced bottles of water for each child. Hand out during round robin event
At the MEV station have an arm immersion heat dump site
Safety Brief, CONOP, PCC/PCI, Constant monitoring of conditions
OIC, NCOs, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

draw.overall_supervision_plan: This is a living document. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level. If risk exceeds a Commander's authority, the subordinate Commander will provide risk mitigation courses of actions (COAs) to higher headquarters IOT obtain risk acceptance approval.
